channel.title: Just a check before removing dual boot
channel.description:
OK, Im about to let my brother have this computer and would like to remove the linux parts. I would just like to quickly check some things beforehand (I have not used google because its too late and i cant be bothered searching for something so simple at this time :D)
ANYWAY, Would I just have to make an XP boot floppy, then run the MBR tool (fdisk /mbr) or something, then open up a partition editor, such as that on the linux installer and delete + adjust my partitions?
If you know what you are talking about, please post.

item.title: Just a check before removing dual boot
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

ty zach, this is gonna help when i give this comp to my sisters after i finish my 1337 comp that i’m building

Read full topic
item.source: Just a check before removing dual boot

item.title: Just a check before removing dual boot
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Yes, your MBR reads off your GRUB which is on the linux partition. You delete the Linux Partition, you also delete GRUB, and then your computer wont boot. So go into Windows, use Partition Magic (or another good partition managing tool), and delete the Linux partition. Now put your WinXP CD into the drive, reboot and make sure your bios is set to boot off the CD drive befire the hard drive, and boot off the CD. I think you press R to enter the recovery console, and you can then repair the MBR. Now boot back into Windows, open your partition manager again, and resize the Windows partition so it takes up the entire hard drive.

Read full topic
item.source: Just a check before removing dual boot

item.title: Just a check before removing dual boot
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:5987”]Delete the Linux Partition. That’s how you get rid of it.[/quote]Ya, but then wouldnt i have to ‘reset’ the master boot record as my puter uses GRUB which is on my linux partition?

Read full topic

Delete the Linux Partition. That’s how you get rid of it.
